channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [PDFBOX-3677] NullPointerException in Type1Parser.read
item.description:
Text extraction from certain PDFs is not possible and PDF Box responses with NullPointerException. Text extraction from same PDF with version 1.8.13 is working.

Originally the issue was discovered while using the newest Apache Tika 1.14 library. I can not down-grade to PDF Box 1.8.13 with Apache Tika 1.14.

Unfortunately I can not provide the PDFs that fail to you. However, I did some testing and found out that “Token token = lexer.nextToken();” return Null.

Feb 07, 2017 12:17:40 PM org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDType1Font <init>
SEVERE: Can't read the embedded Type1 font AAAAAB+Arial-BoldMT
java.io.IOException: Found token=null but expected NAME

Caused by: java.io.EOFException
at org.apache.pdfbox.io.ScratchFileBuffer.seek(ScratchFileBuffer.java:302)
at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.COSParser.checkXRefOffset(COSParser.java:1177)
at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.COSParser.parseXref(COSParser.java:202)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Will see if I can find a triggering file in Tika's regression corpus.

Commit 1782033 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1782033 ]

PDFBOX-3677: avoid NPE

Commit 1782034 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/branches/2.0'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1782034 ]

PDFBOX-3677: avoid NPE

guebeli please try with a snapshot:
https://repository.apache.org/content/groups/snapshots/org/apache/pdfbox/pdfbox-app/2.0.5-SNAPSHOT/

The change will avoid the NPE but the file will still bring trouble. You could extract the (type 1) font with the PDFDebugger command line application. Just go to the resources, the font, then click on each font until it fails. Then search that part of the tree for "FontDescriptor" and then "FontFile", there's the font file. Right-click to save. I suspect that the file is too short.

Please give feedback what happens now.

Thank you for the fast response. Did some testing with the “pdfbox-app-2.0.5-20170207.183804-157.jar”. Think there are two fonts causing trouble.

Running with option “ExtractText”:

SEVERE: Can't read the embedded Type1 font AAAAAB+Arial-BoldMT
java.io.IOException: Found null but expected NAME
at org.apache.fontbox.type1.Type1Parser.read(Type1Parser.java:763)

SEVERE: Can't read the embedded Type1 font AAAAAB+ArialMT
java.io.IOException: Found null but expected NAME
at org.apache.fontbox.type1.Type1Parser.read(Type1Parser.java:763)

I also attached the request Font files using “PDFDebugger”. See F1.txt and F2.txt attached.

Did you copy & paste from the window or do "save stream as"? I'm asking because I'm unable to decrypt the binary segment of the font file, and thus I et a different error. It looks suspicious that you uploaded them as .TXT although PDFDebugger saves them as .PFB.

I also need the values of /Length1 and /Length2, these are in the same stream dictionary. In theory I could get them myself, but it doesn't work.
Here the Fonts "save stream as" and not from copy & past. I even included a screen shot from the Debug GUI about resources.

Thank you, I was able to reproduce the effect with the first file. What happened is that there is a wrong /Length1 value, 1201. For some reason PDFBox fails to correct this (should be 1207) so the ascii part is too short.

Commit 1782244 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1782244 ]

PDFBOX-3677: search for eexec in both directions; remove blank skip from isBinary()

Commit 1782245 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/branches/2.0'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1782245 ]

PDFBOX-3677: search for eexec in both directions; remove blank skip from isBinary()

The search for eexec is now more reliable and the numbers are more exact. Because of that I had to remove the space skip from isBinary (PDFBOX-3654).

Improved files:

  • yours, hopefully
  • PDFBOX-3112.pdf (now better than with Adobe)
  • PDFJS-3928-p4.pdf (now better than with Adobe)

Please test your files again.

Text extraction for the PDFs are working now. Thanks!

I assume that the following warnings are intended..

Feb 09, 2017 4:10:42 PM org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDType1Font repairLength1
WARNING: Ignored invalid Length1 1201 for Type 1 font AAAAAB+Arial-BoldMT
Feb 09, 2017 4:10:42 PM org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDType1Font repairLength2
WARNING: Ignored invalid Length2 13596 for Type 1 font AAAAAB+Arial-BoldMT
Feb 09, 2017 4:10:42 PM org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDType1Font repairLength1
WARNING: Ignored invalid Length1 1189 for Type 1 font AAAAAB+ArialMT
Feb 09, 2017 4:10:42 PM org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDType1Font repairLength2
WARNING: Ignored invalid Length2 17132 for Type 1 font AAAAAB+ArialMT

In another file (that failed as well before the Type1Font fix), there are the following messages:

Feb 09, 2017 4:10:41 PM org.apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.COSParser validateStreamLength
WARNING: The end of the stream doesn't point to the correct offset, using workaround to read the stream, stream start position: 200, length: 3818, expected end position: 4018
Feb 09, 2017 4:10:41 PM org.apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.COSParser validateStreamLength
WARNING: The end of the stream doesn't point to the correct offset, using workaround to read the stream, stream start position: 9338, length: 34466, expected end position: 43804
Feb 09, 2017 4:10:41 PM org.apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.COSParser validateStreamLength
WARNING: The end of the stream doesn't point to the correct offset, using workaround to read the stream, stream start position: 43674, length: 6275, expected end position: 49949
Feb 09, 2017 4:10:41 PM org.apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.COSParser validateStreamLength
WARNING: The end of the stream doesn't point to the correct offset, using workaround to read the stream, stream start position: 49711, length: 34466, expected end position: 84177
Feb 09, 2017 4:10:41 PM org.apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.COSParser validateStreamLength
WARNING: The end of the stream doesn't point to the correct offset, using workaround to read the stream, stream start position: 84029, length: 5188, expected end position: 89217
Feb 09, 2017 4:10:41 PM org.apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.COSParser validateStreamLength
WARNING: The end of the stream doesn't point to the correct offset, using workaround to read the stream, stream start position: 89158, length: 34466, expected end position: 123624
Feb 09, 2017 4:10:41 PM org.apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.COSParser validateStreamLength
WARNING: The end of the stream doesn't point to the correct offset, using workaround to read the stream, stream start position: 123487, length: 12032, expected end position: 135519
Feb 09, 2017 4:10:41 PM org.apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.COSParser validateStreamLength
WARNING: The end of the stream doesn't point to the correct offset, using workaround to read the stream, stream start position: 138048, length: 34466, expected end position: 172514
Feb 09, 2017 4:10:41 PM org.apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.COSParser validateStreamLength
WARNING: The end of the stream doesn't point to the correct offset, using workaround to read the stream, stream start position: 172379, length: 12235, expected end position: 184614
Feb 09, 2017 4:10:41 PM org.apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.COSParser validateStreamLength
WARNING: The end of the stream doesn't point to the correct offset, using workaround to read the stream, stream start position: 184447, length: 34466, expected end position: 218913

Is that something that you you want to lookin as well or is this an other issue?
Note: TextExtration is working for this file as well now

Otherwise, please consider the issue as closed from my side.
Do you have a date when 2.0.5 will be released?

All these warnings mean that the file has bad values, but that these have been corrected. From my feeling, about 50% of our work is related to bad files.

Expect 2.0.5 some time in spring. We usually do releases about every 3 months.
